meanings.definition: Surround and have or hold within.
meanings.sent1: The garden fence will encompass all the flowers.
meanings.sent2: The map will encompass the entire city.
meanings.sent3: The picnic blanket tried to encompass all the food, but some sandwiches escaped.
meanings.sent4: Her love for animals encompassed every creature, big and small.
meanings.sent5: The giant hug from her dad encompassed her in warmth and safety.

meanings.sent1: The book will encompass all the information you need.
meanings.sent2: The package will encompass all the items you ordered.
meanings.sent3: The party planner tried to encompass all the guests' dietary restrictions.
meanings.sent4: His speech encompassed every aspect of the project, leaving no detail out.
meanings.sent5: The painting encompassed all the colors of the rainbow, creating a beautiful masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: The walls will encompass the garden, keeping it safe from animals.
meanings.sent2: The ring will encompass her finger perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The spider's web tried to encompass the fly, but it managed to escape.
meanings.sent4: The necklace encompassed her neck like a delicate chain of pearls.
meanings.sent5: The fortress encompassed the kingdom, protecting it from any outside threats.
